de.tud.kom.socom.components.content

Class ContentManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tud.kom.socom.SocomComponent
      • de.tud.kom.socom.components.content.ContentManager

  • public class ContentManager
extends de.tud.kom.socom.SocomComponent
    Author:
    Rhaban Hark Game-Content-Manager is used to handle Game-Content e.g. Hints, Videos, Level and more. In this manager are methods to upload, download and fetch information of game-content.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static ContentManager getInstance()

      • createUserContent

        public int createUserContent(de.tud.kom.socom.util.SocomRequest req)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException,
                             org.json.JSONException,
                             de.tud.kom.socom.util.exceptions.SocomException
        With this method you can allocate space for your game-content which you can upload after allocating the space. Here you have to specify all information for the content. The method puts a "contentident"-cookie in the response, containing a key you need when uploading the real content.
        Parameters:
        visibility -
        title -
        description -
        type - (text | image | audio | binary)
        category: - (QUESTION, INFORMATION, HINT, SOLUTION)
        Optional - : contextid To which context do this content relate
        all - other parameters will be handled as metadata for this content
        Returns:
        success boolean with contentident cookie
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        org.json.JSONException
        de.tud.kom.socom.util.exceptions.SocomException

      • createGameContent

        public int createGameContent(de.tud.kom.socom.util.SocomRequest req)
                      throws java.sql.SQLException,
                             org.json.JSONException,
                             de.tud.kom.socom.util.exceptions.SocomException
        Equal method to createUserContent. Difference is the visibility is restricted to the game (non-user content).
        Parameters:
        title -
        description -
        type - (text | image | audio | binary)
        category -
        Optional - : contextid To which context do this content relate
        all - other parameters will be handled as metadata for this content
        Returns:
        success boolean with contentident cookie
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        org.json.JSONException
        de.tud.kom.socom.util.exceptions.SocomException

      • uploadContent

        public int uploadContent(de.tud.kom.socom.util.SocomRequest req)
                  throws org.json.JSONException,
                         java.io.IOException,
                         java.sql.SQLException,
                         de.tud.kom.socom.util.exceptions.SocomException
        HTTP-POST-Method After allocating space for a content you can upload the content using the key sent in the "contentident" cookie. The cookie must be sent back (as cookie) here for identification.
        Parameters:
        contentident - as cookie
        Returns:
        The new contentid
        Throws:
        org.json.JSONException
        java.io.IOException
        java.sql.SQLException
        de.tud.kom.socom.util.exceptions.SocomException

      • getContentInfoForContext

        public int getContentInfoForContext(de.tud.kom.socom.util.SocomRequest req)
                             throws java.io.IOException,
                                    org.json.JSONException,
                                    java.sql.SQLException,
                                    de.tud.kom.socom.util.exceptions.SocomException
        Fetch information about content in the given context.
        Parameters:
        context - The context-id where the content should be related to
        Optional - : since Either a date in the form "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" or the date in ms from 01.01.1970 00:00
        Returns:
        List of Content
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        org.json.JSONException
        java.sql.SQLException
        de.tud.kom.socom.util.exceptions.SocomException

      • getContentInfo

        public int getContentInfo(de.tud.kom.socom.util.SocomRequest req)
                   throws java.sql.SQLException,
                          org.json.JSONException,
                          de.tud.kom.socom.util.exceptions.SocomException
        Fetch content-informations for the given filter options.
        Parameters:
        Optional - : contexts Comma-Separated list of contextids where the content must relate to
        Optional - : sincle Either a date in the form "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss" or the date in ms from 01.01.1970 00:00
        Optional - : type Comma-Separated list of types the should could be of one of it
        Optional - : keywords Comma-Separated list of keywords the description must contain
        Optional - : metadata Form: key1:value1,key2:value2,... which the content MUST contain, escape double-points with /: and commatas with /,
        Returns:
        List of contents
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        org.json.JSONException
        de.tud.kom.socom.util.exceptions.SocomException
